comments.author: You Hi

comments.text:
+Antonio Dasilva You do know that Apple Mac's and/or iMac's only have the 
Laptop variants of hardware, right?
 
Also, a custom built tower or MSI, AlienWare or RoG device will easily run 
faster than any other Apple Mac out there due to the fact that they have 
the more powerful variants of hardware.
 
Also, Windows and Linux are way more convenient OS due to the fact that 
they have a outstandingly better amount of customizability, and are 
designed so you can do whatever you want with your OS. (This statement 
comes from personal experience, i own both an iMac and a custom built 
tower.)


And to crush your ''a hacker can use whatever computer they like, it 
doesn't matter'' fantasy: No, if you want to commit to any form of hacking 
you will need to have a decent stable OS, and a significantly higher amount 
of RAM because you will need to run a lot of programs, scripts, CMD 
windows, etc. at the same time. (This depends on what you are doing, of 
course.) So you will need a significant amount of RAM in your device to 
keep your device from getting slow and deepfrying your own PC's circuits, 
which is fatal to your computer, FYI. 


So you will need to have more RAM than any Mac has built in, and since 
Apple does not allow any form of tinkering on your iMac/Mac device, it 
would be a retarded idea and plain suicide for your Mac to `hack` something 
with an Apple device, because you will most likely fry it's circuits. So 
i'm sorry to pop your little bubble, kid.

comments.text:
This type of tech is widely used today by military and governments. And 
"apparently" it will be made public soon. As facebooks systems are giving 
you the options to sign up for their service. Which pins key features that 
make you unique. So that a computer can recognise you without a human 
telling it that your there. Apparently this will help Facebook to see what 
your into and help you find mutal friends by scanning the pictures and 
telling you everyone who is in it. Without the need for tagging. I don't 
know if I can believe they will do this until I see it. But if they are 
open enough to talk to the press about it. Then there's got to be a smart 
ass tech guy who's looking into it.
comments.author: Jason Cox

comments.text:
+Ethan Salie To clarify: if a network is not setup correctly or your in a 
public area, I have that power, and the skill to use it. But it all works 
two ways, just as easily as I can setup a MITM(Man In the Middle) attack 
(Google it)  on a target and gather information on it, the target could 
easily prevent me from getting that information with the right security 
tools. 
This does not however mean I invade everyone's privacy and steal stuff. In 
fact i do the opposite, any time i find a vulnerability in anyone's 
security I notify them immediately. This does not however mean that people 
with less morals than I have don't use that power for really bad purposes. 
If you want an example of a really bad use of hacking skills, look up 
Anonymous.
comments.author: Peter Gorbunov

comments.author: Ethan Salie

comments.text:
Crazy thing is, this technology already does exist. depending on encryption 
levels it can be quite easy to not only break into private networks, and 
download photos both from computers and laptops, it is also surprisingly 
easy to break get email, Facebook, and any other social site passwords you 
can think of once you have access to that persons network. 
Craziest part about this is all this technology is not only in the wrong 
hands, its in everyone's hands. most of the tools you need to do this kind 
of stuff is free and open source. It has to be, otherwise we would barely 
be able to defend ourselves from these kinds of tools. it just takes skill 
and patience... lots of patience :P
comments.author: Peter Gorbunov
